german_shepherd.name: GERMAN SHEPHERD
german_shepherd.history: The German Shepherd, also known in Britain as an Alsatian, is a German breed of working dog of medium to large size. The breed was developed by Max von Stephanitz using various traditional Herman herding dogs form 1899.
german_shepherd.otherNames: Alsatian, Alsatian Wolf Dog, Deutscher Schäferhund, Altdeutsche Schäferhunde, GSD

golden_retriever.name: GOLDEN RETRIEVER
golden_retriever.history: Originated in Scotland in the mid-1800s, developed by Lord Tweedmouth to create the perfect hunting companion capable of retrieving waterfowl in both water and land.

siberian_husky.name: SIBERIAN HUSKY
siberian_husky.history: Originally developed by the Chukchi people of northeastern Asia as an endurance sled dog. They were brought to Alaska during the Nome Gold Rush for sled-dog racing and became popular across North America.
siberian_husky.color: Black and white, gray and white, red and white, or pure white

bulldog.name: BULLDOG
bulldog.history: Originally bred for bull baiting in England during the 13th century. After the sport was banned in 1835, the breed was refined into a gentler companion dog.
bulldog.color: Red, white, fawn, or brindle, often with white markings

beagle.name: BEAGLE
beagle.history: One of the oldest dog breeds, developed in England for hunting rabbits and hares. The modern breed was established in the 1830s from several older breeds including the Talbot Hound.
beagle.color: Tri-color (black, white, and brown), or bi-color

alaskan_husky.name: ALASKAN HUSKY
alaskan_husky.history: A purpose-bred working dog developed in Alaska, not a pure breed but a type of dog bred specifically for sledding. They were crucial during the Alaskan Gold Rush for transportation.
alaskan_husky.color: Various, including black, white, gray, and red
alaskan_husky.otherNames: Alaskan Sled Dog, Racing Husky, Mal, Mally

poodle.name: POODLE
poodle.history: Despite their association with France, Poodles originated in Germany as water retrievers. The name comes from the German word 'Pudel' meaning 'to splash in water.'
poodle.otherNames: Caniche, Barbone (Italian), French Poodle, Pudel, Pudelhund

chihuahua.name: CHIHUAHUA
chihuahua.history: Named after the Mexican state of Chihuahua, these tiny dogs are believed to descend from the Techichi, a companion dog favored by the Toltec civilization.

persian.name: PERSIAN
persian.history: One of the oldest cat breeds, originating from Persia (modern-day Iran). They were first introduced to Europe in the 1600s and became popular among nobility.
persian.color: Various including white, black, blue, red
persian.otherNames: Iranian Cat, Shirazi Cat, Persian Longhair

siamese.name: SIAMESE
siamese.history: Ancient breed from Siam (modern-day Thailand), considered sacred and kept by royal families. First appeared in the West in the late 1800s.
siamese.color: Point coloration with seal, blue, chocolate, or lilac
siamese.otherNames: Wichien-maat (Thai), Moon Diamond (historical), Thai Cat, Royal Cat of Siam

british_shorthair.name: BRITISH SHORTHAIR
british_shorthair.history: Descendants of Roman cats brought to Britain, they are one of the oldest English breeds. They nearly went extinct during World War II but were saved through crossbreeding.
british_shorthair.color: Blue-gray classic, also various other colors

maine_coon.name: MAINE COON
maine_coon.history: Native to the state of Maine, USA. Many legends surround their origin, including one claiming they're descendants of Marie Antoinette's cats.
maine_coon.otherNames: American Longhair, Maine Cat, American Forest Cat, Gentle Giant

ragdoll.name: RAGDOLL
ragdoll.history: Developed in California in the 1960s by Ann Baker. Named for their tendency to go limp when held, like a ragdoll.

sphynx.name: SPHYNX
sphynx.history: Originated from a natural mutation in Toronto, 1966. Developed through selective breeding of hairless cats with Devon Rex cats.
sphynx.color: All colors and patterns visible on skin

american_shorthair.name: AMERICAN SHORTHAIR
american_shorthair.history: Descended from European cats that came to North America with early settlers. Valued for their hunting abilities on ships and farms.
american_shorthair.color: More than 80 different colors and patterns

burmese.name: BURMESE
burmese.history: Originated in Burma (Myanmar), developed in the US from a single cat named Wong Mau in the 1930s.
burmese.otherNames: Sacred Cat of Burma (historical), Copper Cat
